body.p: To His Excellency Thomas. E. Bramlett Governor of Kentucky

Your petitioner John Miller would respectfully State to your excellency that he was attack rcognised in the Franklin Circuit Court to appear as a witness for the Commonwealth against Meritt charged with Feloney petitioner was misinformed as to the Day that his attendance was required and attendance one ^week^ day after said recognicence was forfeited and a Judgement for one hundred dollar rendered against him and costs petitioner is now confined in the Jail of Jefferson County for the payment of said Debt and has so been for two weeak past. petitioner is poor and unable to pay said debt he prays your Excellency to remit the portion of said Deft due the state will ever pray
John Miller states that the statements contained in the foregoing petition is true as he believes

subscribed & sworn to before me this 20th 1863
J. P. Gailbriath
Notary Public J. P. Ky
J. P. Gailbraith Atty at Law
